ratings.comment: not suitable to be a lecturer
The worst class I have ever had.

Hands down worst teacher I have EVER had.  She teaches to us as if we were in first grade so all of the stuff seems really easy...and then the exam comes.  She takes off for the smallest stuff and is just unfair! Do not take a class with her!

We were supposed to go through chapter eight, but we barely got into chapter 5.  The pace is VERY slow at times.  Material seems easy in lecture, but everyone seems to do poorly on the exams. Luckily the curve is generous.

Horrible teacher-- not even a professor, she's a TA so I have NOOOO idea why the University keeps having her teach!!! She refuses to do teacher eval. probably b/c she knows she sucks! She is very hard to understand and has a terrible curve on tests. Spends an entire class period drawing pictures on the board as if we don't get it! PULL MY HAIR OUT!
Lectures were so terrible that I started counting the number of times she says "in other words."  She averages about 52 times a lecture.

Avoid this teacher, she is extremely difficult to understand.  The worst part though....she does not hand out a syllabus, so you are always left wondering what is being covered.  She rarely returns e-mail, so the class is a challenge in finding what to do for homework.

WORST PROFF I HAVE EVER HAD.. I dont know how she even still works here....theres been days where I and 4 other ppl will the only ones there because no one can understand her. Her lectures have almost no relavence to what we should be learning so you pretty much have to teach yourself. Im complaining to the Unviersity. AVOID!
in utter wurds...you're horrible!
She sucks!

Calc 1, 2, and 3...My boyfriend and best friend are in math-based majors and I am doing things that they as sophomores just did this semester in Calc 3! And she hasn't taught the 8 hardest sections, and classes are over, and she expects us to learn them on our own for the exam!!!!!!

This class is good for preparing pre-business majors. It takes concepts from both Calc 1 and 2. BUT, she does not present well. She seems unsure of the material herself. Her accent is difficult to follow, and her penmanship isn't much better. The curve is like the Psych 202 curve--it hurts you!!!

She is simply not a good teacher. I'm surprised she is still employed to be honest. A math class should not be curved to hurt you like a psych 202 class can. She does not speak very well and occasionally makes mistakes in her problems and students have to help her.  Overall, though, the curve is ridiculous where you can have a 99% and have an A/B.

The curriculum for the class isn't that bad, but she presents in a way that's tough to understand.  She spends more time proving worthless equations than actually applying them.  Tests are tough, and she is terrible at answering questions.  So, "in other words" I would recommend a different professor or get an amazing TA.

Pretty hard to understand at times, but luckily i had a great TA. definitely got more out of discussion than lecture. the first test was so easy 1/2 the class got 100% so she made the curve so that the only way to get an A was with 100%. the next test however was impossible, and the class average was a 62%. make sure your TA can speak clear english

Terrible Prof.  Do not take under any circumstances.  Her tests are way way way hard.  I had friends in the same class with different professors that liked the class!  She made it a walk through hell.
Can't handle a lecture.  Is not very clear in her explanations. Assignments are very easy but tests are all over the place. In other words...try to opt out of her session and get a better TEACHER.
don't do it to yourself, im telling you.  she is the worst teacher i've ever come across.  i dont go to lectures anymore because she is impossible to understand!  inudda woods! hah aobing is a joke!

Terrible Terrible Terrible is the only way i can describe her.  Avoid at all costs.  There is no reason the university should have hired her. very unclear and uses the phrase "een utta woods (in other words)" like its a drug.  the mere sight of her enrages me.

I give her credit for learning a second language, but she doesn't speak it well enough to be a college professor.  I'm even pretty good at math and this class has been next to impossible for me.  I've been teaching myself from the book, and thankfully had a good TA.  Get out of this class if you can.  She's a horrible teacher!

THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! I don't even know if she speaks English and she is often wrong while doing math problems. Her first test was ridiculously easy thus she made the curve that only 100% was an A (which is ridiculous)! The 2nd test, as a result, was imposible!!! I dont recommend this class!

She is the worst professor I've ever had.  Her speech is barely comprehensible and she presents the material in a way that doesn't provide any context to real world application.  She only assigns one problem a week, which puts the emphasis on you to figure out what the hell she's actually trying to teach.  If it wasn't required, I'd drop the class.

Unless you are very good at deciphering difficult accents, avoid at all costs.  Teaches right out of the book, very unorganized, always late to class, takes days to respond to e-mails.  Luckily since she's horrible everyone does pretty terribly and there's a wicked curve at the end of the class.
Not very clear, talks into the board, very quiet, tests were not very hard however. Thankfully I had a great TA and great solution manual to teach me most the material.
